document.docAuthor: Song, Zi-Wei, Xue, Xiao-Feng & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species and a new name in the genus Rhyncaphytoptus Keifer (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Diptilomiopidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species and a new name in the genus Rhyncaphytoptus Keifer (Acari: Eriophyoidea: Diptilomiopidae) from China

heading.emphasis:
Key to
Rhyncaphytoptus
species in China

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Female
genital coverflap with either longitudinal ridges or granules .......................................................... 3
- Female genital coverflap with neither longitudinal ridges nor granules ...................................................... 5

3 Female
genital coverflap only with granules at base...............................
Rhyncaphytoptus yilisis
sp. nov.

4 Female
genital coverflap with 8-9 longitudinal ridges and basal oblique lines, scapular tubercles located on rear shield margin, scapular setae ( sc ) directed forward ...........................................................................
............................................................................................. Rhyncaphytoptus acer
Chen, Wei & Qin, 2004

- Female genital coverflap with only 9 longitudinal ridges, scapular tubercles set near base, scapular setae ( sc ) directed to rear
.................................................................. Rhyncaphytoptus cryptomerus
Huang, 2001

6 Ventral annuli smooth
........................................................ Rhyncaphytoptus microstegii
Wei & Feng, 1999

- Dorsal annuli smooth, empodium 7 -rayed
................... Rhyncaphytoptus lushanensis
Kuang & Zhao, 1987

9 Dorsal annuli laterally with small spines on rear annular margins, otherwise smooth ..................................
................................................................................................ Rhyncaphytoptus ulmivagrans
Keifer, 1939 b

11 Accessory setae (
h 1
) absent, empodium 7 -rayed
............... Rhyncaphytoptus ipomoeae
Kuang & Shi, 1990
12 Empodium 5 -rayed, dorsal annuli with triangle or spiny microtubercles................................................... 13
13 Prodorsal shield design with obscure median line, dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles .................... 14
- Prodorsal shield design with distinct median line, dorsal annuli with triangle microtubercles.................. 15

14 Two transverse lines between median line and admedian lines, between dorsal tubercles and inside sub- median lines with arc marking
...................... Rhyncaphytoptus ulmi chongqingensis
Kuang & Hong, 1991

15 Prodorsal shield design with complete submedian lines, dorsal annuli with triangular microtubercles on annular rear margins
............................................................. Rhyncaphytoptus hangzhouensis
Kuang, 1998

- Prodorsal shield design with incomplete submedian lines, dorsal annuli with triangular microtubercles ahead of annular margins
.................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus caricae
Zhao & Kuang, 1998

17 Female
genital coverflap with transverse lines basally
....................... Rhyncaphytoptus boczeki
Hall, 1967

19 Accessory setae (
h 1
) present
............................................... Rhyncaphytoptus betulae
Kuang & Hong, 1990

20 Prodorsal shield design with distinct median line, median line connected with admedian lines with two transverse lines, empodium 6 or 7 -rayed
...................... Rhyncaphytoptus zhongshani
Zhao & Kuang, 1998

22 Dorsal opisthosoma with five longitudinal ridges
.......... Rhyncaphytoptus fabris
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006

23 Accessory setae (
h 1
) present, dorsal shield smooth
.......................... Rhyncaphytoptus ziziphi
Kuang, 2005

24 Prodorsal shield design with median line connected with admedian lines with a transverse line at near median, scapular tubercles ahead of shield rear margin, tarsal solenidion rod-like .......................................
......................................................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus lonicerae
Kuang & Zhao, 1987

- Prodorsal shield design with median line and admedian lines subparallel, scapular tubercles on shield rear margin, tarsal solenidion knobbed
............................................. Rhyncaphytoptus mori
Liu & Kuang, 1998

25 Prodorsal shield smooth
....................................... Rhyncaphytoptus cotoneasteri
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006

26 Prodorsal shield design entirely with many dashes, scapular setae very long ( 210 m).................................
...................................................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus abiesis
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006
- Prodorsal shield design with lines, scapular setae are shorter. ................................................................... 27

28 Female
genital coverflap with longitudinal ridges
.......... Rhyncaphytoptus longipalpis
Xue & Hong, 2005

29 Prosternal apodeme present
......................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus potentillae
Keifer, 1962

- Prosternal apodeme absent
........................................... Rhyncaphytoptus fargesis
Xue, Song & Hong, 2006

30 Scapular setae projecting backward, empodium 8 -rayed
........ Rhyncaphytoptus illicis
Kuang & Luo, 2005

31 Dorsal annuli with spiny microtubercles on rear annular margins, empodium 5 -rayed.................................
....................................................................................... Rhyncaphytoptus taihangensis
Xue & Hong, 2005
- Dorsal annuli with round microtubercles on rear annular margins, empodium 6 -rayed ............................ 32

32 Coxal area with short lines, tarsal solenidion knobbed ...............
Rhyncaphytoptus longyuwanis
sp. nov.

- Coxal area with granules, tarsal solenidion tapered
........ Rhyncaphytoptus papyriferae
Xue & Hong, 2005
